introduction: Welcome to Padget’s Smart SMT Line! I’m Maalinee, your AI assistant for Machine Intelligence & Notifications. Let me introduce our Koh Young SPI & AOI machines, the heart of our quality assurance process in Surface Mount Technology (SMT)

faqs.question: What is SPI
faqs.answer:
The Kohyoung SPI ensures perfect solder paste printing—the foundation of high-quality solder joints. It performs full 3D inspections to measure: Volume, height, area, and shape of the solder paste.

Detects defects like insufficient solder, bridging, misalignment, and foreign material immediately after the printing process.

Benefits:
Eliminates downstream defects by catching printing issues early.

Provides real-time SPC data and closed-loop feedback to the printer for auto-correction.

Enables higher FPY (First Pass Yield) for the SMT process.

faqs.question: What is Current Yield?
faqs.answer: First Pass Yield (FPY) 98.5% . False Call Rate 0.8% . Top Failures Detected are Insufficient solder, bridging, excess solder.

faqs.question: How to operate the SPI machine?
faqs.answer: To operate the SPI machine, first turn it on, then load the PCB, and start the inspection process.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of using SPI?
faqs.answer:
The benefits of using SPI include:

1. Early detection of printing defects, reducing downstream issues.
2. Real-time feedback for process optimization.
3. Improved First Pass Yield (FPY) in the SMT process.
